ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Chronic Tympanic Membrane Perforation (Left Ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of chronic ear infections, failed tympanoplasty, and Type B tympanogram with large ear canal volume (4.3 mL).

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Mixed Hearing Loss (Left Ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Audiogram shows air-bone gaps with moderate to severe/profound thresholds; consistent with perforation and potential ossicular or cochlear involvement.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sensorineural Hearing Loss (Right Ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Sloping thresholds with no air-bone gaps and Type A tympanogram.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Active Otorrhea (Left Ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Observed drainage in the left ear requiring suctioning.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Visual inspection of the ear canal and tympanic membrane to assess for perforation or infection.
Determine the degree, type, and configuration of hearing loss.
Assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
Evaluate middle ear function and confirm tympanic membrane perforation status.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presents with a slight to mild-moderately severe sensorineural hearing loss in the right ear and a moderate mixed sloping to severe-profound hearing loss in the left ear. Speech recognition is excellent bilaterally. Tympanometry indicates normal middle ear function in the right ear and a patent tympanic membrane perforation in the left ear (large volume Type B). Active otorrhea was noted in the left ear.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Slight SNHL (250-1000 Hz) sloping to mild-to-moderately severe (2000-8000 Hz). Left ear: Moderate mixed loss (250-3000 Hz) sloping to severe-to-profound (4000-8000 Hz).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right SRT 35 dB HL, WRS 96% at 75 dB HL. Left SRT 55 dB HL, WRS 92% at 90 dB HL. Results in agreement with PTA.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Type A (ECV 1.9 mL). Left ear: Type B flat with large ear canal volume (4.3 mL), consistent with perforation.

tests.name: Otoscopy/Medical Exam
tests.result_summary: Otorrhea present in the left ear; suctioned by otologist.

proposed_items: Dry ear precautions (keep water out of left ear)
Repeat tympanoplasty (conditional on left ear being infection-free for 3 months)
counseling_actions: Instruction to keep water out of the left ear to prevent further infection

escalation.rationale_short: Active otorrhea and chronic perforation require immediate medical management (suctioning, antibiotics) and surgical consideration.

follow_up_plan.objective: Re-evaluate infection status for potential tympanoplasty; annual monitoring of hearing.
